Author: SemicolonButterfly
Text: I mean, someone who is throwing up (intentionally or otherwise) as part of drinking is someone with their own set of struggles, whether they’re ready to see that or not. Often, the most judgmental people are those who struggle with similar demons. (‘If you spot it, you got it’ as the saying goes.)    It’s hard when someone else’s pronouncements dovetail with our own fears, but I really hope you can set his words aside. It sounds like he’s talking a big talk but really just as lost in the weeds as the rest of us.

Author: livipup
Text: For someone so obsessed with health he evidently knows so little about it. You need carbs, the ketogenic diet is to help reduce chronic seizures (*not for losing weight*), and vomiting is never good for you. You literally only vomit naturally if what's going on in your stomach is so bad for you that your body needs to expel it or if you're sick and a virus is making you throw up. It's so bad for your throat and teeth.  There's no way it can be considered healthy.
